item.title: Fish Roundabout - Erith., 7th August
item.description:
Does litter always surround this impressive monument ? Please delegate the regular removal of rubbish that congregates around its proximity.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bexley Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: These Linden trees are very proific, and have needed ollarding for some years., 7th August
item.description:
There is hardly a month in the year that we are not plagued by twigs, seeds, pollen, leaves, etc from these (otherwise beautiful) trees. I was told after a recent complaint that there were plans to pollard all the ridgeway drive trees by October. I this still the case? I notice the tree outside 181 was trimmed to protect a new lampost today.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ridgeway Drive, Sundridge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 83 Great Titchfield street W1 ( bags all day ), 7th August
item.description:
Once again 83 seems to be allowed to leave their bags out all day ? Can WCC speak to this company and block as it happens regularly. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Middleton Place, Fitzrovia, Camden Town, City of Westminster

item.title: Tree fallen blocking the grass area, 7th August
item.description:
The tree that is coming through the fences near the eletric box area has taken a tumble and needs to be looked at and removed. However, overall this patch of trees needs looking at as clearly it’s apart of the two massive trees that’s close to that box itself. They need to be checked due to branches have fallen it’s very big and clearly a hazard risk so maybe the council can serve a notice to the housing who have them in their garden.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ravensworth Road, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Engine idling *AGAIN*, 7th August
item.description:
